2 ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~;: 3 ^ In the days of my trouble I sought God
with my hands lifted up to him in the night
column3: and I was not deceived~; my soul refused to be comforted.

2 ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~;: 5 ^ My eyes prevented the watches~; I was troubled
6 ^ I thought upon the days of old
and I had in my mind the eternal years.

2 ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~;: 7 ^ And I meditated in the night with my own heart
and I was exercised and I swept my spirit.

2 ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~;: 8 ^ Will God then cast off for ever
and will he never be more favourable again~?

2 ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~;: 9 ^ Or will he cut off his mercy for ever
10 ^ Or will God forget to show mercy~? Or will he in his anger shut up his mercies~?

"Now have I begun~; this is the change of the right hand of the most High."

2 ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~;: 12 ^ I remembered the works of the Lord
for I will be mindful of thy wonders from the beginning.

2 ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~;: 13 ^ And I will meditate on all thy works
and will be employed in thy inventions.

column3: is in the holy place~; who is the great God like our God~?

2 ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~;: 15 ^ Thou art the God that dost wonders~; thou hast made thy power known among the nations.
16 ^ With thy arm thou hast redeemed thy people
the children of Jacob and of Joseph.
O God~; the waters saw thee

2 ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~;: 18 ^ Great are the roarings of the waters~; the clouds sent out a sound
19 ^ The voice of thy thunder in a wheel~; thy lightnings enlightened the world~; the earth shook and trembled.
20 ^ Thy way is in the sea
and thy paths in many waters
column3: and thy footsteps shall not be known.

2 ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~;: 21 ^ Thou hast conducted thy people like sheep
by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
